results.title: Forgotten empire
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: A survey of the remains of the ancient Viyayanagar Empire in Andhra State: the grand palaces, the magnificent gateways, beautiful frescoes and temples in the historical city of Viyayangar. This once mighty Hindu empire was founded in 1336 A.D. by two brothers-Hakka and Bukka-to serve as the strongest bastion of the south against recurrent invasions. The fateful battle of Talikota in 1565 brought ruin to the kingdom. Commentary written by Berkeley Hill and narrated by Romesh Thapar.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad

results.title: Forgotten Cinema
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley Productions and Anthony Buckley
results.brief_description: A history of theatrical film production in Australia including brief extracts from features illustrating development from the 19th Century to the postwar period. The problems of distribution of Australian films are explored, and well known film industry figures Ken G. Hall and Mrs. Elsa Chauvel discuss difficulties encountered.

results.title: Forget me not
results.creator_credit: Luigi Acquisto, Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Chloe Kimberley
results.brief_description: Set in Australia in the 1960’s, “Forget me not” is a short drama about Anna (Alice Garner), a young Italo-Australian woman who is forced to abandon caring for her younger, intellectually disabled sister through the devious machinations of her widowed father. Examining grief, loss, and the deeply embedded patriarchal mores of mid-century Australia - in both the Italian and Anglo communities - this short film is an evocative period piece.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luigi Acquisto, Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Chloe Kimberley

results.title: Forge and ornamental iron
results.creator_credit: Joe Hayward, Alan Lloyd and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hand Operations-Metal Work”.
A description of the gas forge and its operation. Shows various tongs, parts of the anvil, and safety rules in forge operation.

results.title: Forever young
results.creator_credit: Chris Griffin, Enigma, Goldcrest Films and David Drury
results.brief_description: Just like “That’ll be the day” (1973) and “Stardust” (1974), “Forever young” reflects the late 1950s, early 1960s, British generation of youth, their relationships, their culture, and of course, their music - Ray Connolly being responsible for writing all three screen plays. The central characters of “Forever young,” Michael (Nicholas Gecks) and Jimmy (James Aubrey) grew up together in the late 1950s and became inseparable as teenagers in the early 1960s, spending a good deal of their time listening to rock’n’roll music and playing together in a band. Their friendship however was eventually pushed to the limits upon the arrival of a young girl on the scene. The two men, after having not seen each other for twenty years, are finally reunited - Michael has become a priest and Jimmy a university lecturer and both are seemingly overjoyed at the initial encounter. Unfortunately it is not long before the old rivalries return, only this time it is centred around a young mother and her son. The conflicts of times past emerge and personal differences begin to take over the newly revived friendship. Set in the early 1980s, the film relies on flashbacks (in b&w) and some great 1960s music soundtrack to tell the story. Cast also includes Karen Archer, Alec McCowen, Liam Holt. Executive Producer: David Puttnam.

results.title: Forever young
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Robin Lehman
results.brief_description: Examines the fear of aging and what post-retirement years are really like by interviewing a group of active, interested people, all over the age of 65. They speak of their enjoyment and appreciation of life, their health, happiness, retirement, sex and death.

results.title: Forever James Dean
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the short career of screen legend James Dean. Features loads of stills, his first screen appearance for ‘Pepsi’ and clips and trailers of his three feature films: “East of Eden”, “Rebel without a cause” and “Giant”. Contains some contemporary interviews and features a song written for the film made in the 1980s. Narrated by Bob Gunton.

results.title: Forests of pine
results.brief_description: The steps in pine plantation management and a rationale for their use. Details of the various types of forests in Tasmania, their climatic conditions and locations. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Forests and conservation
results.brief_description: The critical problem of how to conserve and utilize the forest resources of USA. Selective logging, re-afforestation and fire-prevention are three of the most vital methods.

results.title: Forestry in South Africa
results.creator_credit: Film Services and South African Government
results.brief_description: Stresses the economic importance of timber. Surveys the limited areas of indigenous forests to be found in South Africa which are of any commercial value; portrays various forest activities including re-afforestation; nursery plantation, transplantation; removal of unwanted growths; thinning; protection against fire; felling; mill sawing.
